content: What capital city, located on the Potomac River, was named in honor of the first U.S. president?

Washington D.C., the capital city of the United States, is located on the Potomac River and was indeed named in honor of George Washington, the first U.S. president. The city was established as the nation's capital in 1790 and was originally a federal district carved out of land from Maryland and Virginia (though the Virginia portion was later returned). The naming of the city after George Washington was a way to honor his leadership and contributions to the nation.
